{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328984,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T12:39:56.505Z","cooked":"

Hi, I just saw the new Limelight G3. As it looks it is just a limelight 3 with a global shutter and some software improvements. The camera module that is used is relatively cheap(55 usd) what do you think about just changing the camera module and essentely getting a Limelight 3G?

If you can run pipelines on the camera that is connected to the USB, you can just connect an OV9281 and get similar results.

Introducing Limelight 3G

The manual global shutter upgrade doc is happening within a few days.

Changing the hardware is supposed to be possible per the original release of the LL3.

docs.limelightvision.io

Limelight 3 Global Shutter Upgrade | Limelight Documentation

Print the new front enclosure half

The limelight website has some notes about how to do the upgrade, it sounds pretty straightforward.

cmdada:

one issue I could think of would be the physical spacing/mounting for the cameras, has anyone done a successful swap?

We 3D printed the front enclosure half in the link above and swapped the cameras on all 4 of our Limelight 3s.

The hardest part was focusing the new camera lens because that has to be done before itâ€™s mounted to the enclosure, but still connected to the board via the fragile ribbon cable, then glued after without moving it. Beyond that the process is pretty straight-forward. Donâ€™t forget to screenshot your position settings (you cannot import v3 settings into v3G) and flash them with the 3G firmware!

reimerit:

We just purchased an OV9281-110 Mono Camera as Limelight recommends for the upgrade, but the ribbon cable that comes with the camera does not fit on the limelight board. is there some sort of adapter or different cable that I am meant to order? Has anyone else had success with the upgrade?

You should be able to use the ribbon cable that was already installed in the Limelight. Just remove it from the old camera and plug it into the new one, the Limelights ribbon cable is different on each side and acts like an adapter (though you should verify the end connected to the existing camera looks the same as the one you bought, in case you got a weird version or something).
